intro: Serjania gracilis, commonly known as the slender serjania, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy fruits that are an important food source for birds and small mammals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded understory environments. Due to habitat loss, Serjania gracilis is considered vulnerable and is a focus of conservation efforts in its native range.
